definition: broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Yeah I love scuffed up cowboy boots and broken tore up jeans.
sentences.chinese: 是的我愛穿磨損牛仔靴破洞襤褸牛仔褲。

sentences.english: The rainwater is splashing down from the hole of the roof.
sentences.chinese: 雨水從屋頂的破洞處嘩嘩往下流。

sentences.english: The boy felt embarrassed when he found a hole in his pants .
sentences.chinese: 那男孩發現褲子尚有個破洞時，尷尬得不得了。

sentences.english: You don't know how to fix the holes in our ozone layer.
sentences.chinese: 你們不知道該如何填補臭氧層的破洞吧？

sentences.english: The prisoner wormed out through a hole in the fence.
sentences.chinese: 那個囚犯從籬笆上的破洞爬了出去。

sentences.english: Comfy and guaranteed hole-free for 3 years and to dry overnight, virtually always.
sentences.chinese: 舒適並且在3年內保證不破洞，過夜就幹。

sentences.english: We’re going to remove the underwear that is stretched out, droopy, saggy, or with holes.
sentences.chinese: 我們將要移除已拉伸，下垂，鬆懈或是有破洞的內衣。

sentences.english: I'd wear holes on my trainers, and graze up my knees.
sentences.chinese: 我會穿着破洞的球鞋，擦傷我的雙膝。

sentences.english: Attention-getting ripped jeans are the denim equivalent of a pick-up line.
sentences.chinese: 穿着引人注意的破洞牛仔褲像是在等人搭訕。

sentences.english: Poorly patched spaces, bad surfaces and larger holes are not allowable.
sentences.chinese: 不允許存在修補不良的枕段，損壞枕段及較大破洞。

sentences.english: It flies into a hole in the roof.
sentences.chinese: 它從屋頂上的一個破洞飛進去。

sentences.english: Idea sews on the clothes to cover up a hole with this pattern.
sentences.chinese: 意，用這個圖案縫在衣服上遮蓋住破洞。

sentences.english: Or did one of the Trustees notice the hole in little Susie's stockings?
sentences.chinese: 還是有董事大人看到了小蘇西襪子上的破洞？
